Cuando el Mago errante duérgar entre en juego, si controlas dos o más llanuras, puedes destruir el encantamiento objetivo.

regras.texto: Each of the triggered abilities has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control two or more lands of the appropriate land type when the Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you don't control two or more lands of the appropriate land type by the time it resolves.
Both abilities trigger at the same time. You can put them on the stack in any order.
Each of the triggered abilities look at your lands individually. This means that if you only control two dual-lands of the appropriate types, both of the abilities will trigger
Both abilities are optional; you choose whether to use them when they resolve. If an ability has a target, you must choose a target even if you don't plan to use the ability.

Arrojar hace daño igual a la fuerza de la criatura sacrificada a la criatura o jugador objetivo.
50.texto: A veces el artillero debe convertirse en artillería.

regras.texto: The sacrificed creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.

If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

51.descricao: Cuando el Guardabosque silvano entre al campo de batalla, puedes buscar en tu biblioteca una carta de tierra básica, mostrarla, ponerla en tu mano y luego barajar tu biblioteca.
51.texto: "No todos los caminos están en el suelo del bosque."
